questions.question: What is the name of the capitol city of the Aztec Empire?

choices.answer: Chitzen Itza
Culhuacan
Mt. Alban
Tenochtitlan

questions.question: Which of the following is FALSE about Chinampas?

choices.answer: Yielded the Aztecs only two crop rotations a year
Were a system of farming that worked well on shallow lakes.
Were on average the size of a football field.
Utilized the root system of the Willow tree.

questions.question: Which city is now built on top of the ruins of Tenochtitlan?

choices.answer: Cozumel
Mexico City
Phoenix
Mazatlan

questions.question: What were the calpulli?

choices.answer: A large house
Warriors who were allowed to live with the Huey/Emperor
Priests who worked only for the Huey/Emperor
Founding families that managed land and city functions.

questions.question: Who was allowed to attended school?

choices.answer: All children over the age of 10
Only children of Nobles and Priests
Only Boys
Only members of the Capulli

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT an Aztec god?

choices.answer: Huitzilopotchli
Quetzalcoatl
Chad
Tlaloc

questions.question: What was the spoken language of the Aztecs called?

choices.answer: Glyphs
Quechua
Nahuatl
Spanish

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a weapon used by Aztec Warriors

choices.answer: Atlatls
Bows & Arrows
Swords
Maquahuitl

questions.question: How many men did Cortez bring with him to conquer the Aztec?
Which of the following is a difference between the Mayans and Aztecs?

choices.answer: The use of a caste system to organize their society
The use of glyphs and codexes to express themselves
The practice of polytheism
The incorporation of math and astronomy into their buildings

questions.question: What was the symbol the Aztecs were to look for to find their new capitol city?

choices.answer: A wolf with two human children in a cave.
A burning bush that spoke to their priests.
A tree that rose to the heavens with a bushel of corn in it.
An Eagle sitting on cactus holding a snake.

questions.question: Which one is NOT a form of tribute?

choices.answer: a gift given freely from one to another.
a tax paid in currency to a government
a payment required in goods or services to a leader
payment made periodically by one state or ruler to another

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a reason for Hernan Cortez' success against the Aztec

choices.answer: The relationship he developed with his translator Malintzin
Manipulation of tribes against the Aztec and each other
His close relationship with Diego Vel√°zquez
He was gifted at military strategy, and driven to succeed.

questions.question: Aztecs sacrificed more people than any other civilization.  Who was eligible for this honor?

choices.answer: Captured Warriors
Nobles
Slaves
Merchants

questions.question: Which of the following TRUE about similarities between the Aztec and the Mayan Civilizations.

choices.answer: Both used similar farming techniques that led to a surplus.
Both built their cities in similar environments.
Both farmed, hunted, and traded similar goods.
Both civilizations were destroyed in similar ways.

questions.question: What were the motivations for Spanish conquistadors?

choices.answer: Gold, Greed, & Grab
Gold, Glory, & Grace
God, Glory, & Gold
Glory, God, & Glee

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a division of the Aztec military?

choices.answer: The Eagles
The Apocalypto
The Jaguars
The Shorn Ones

questions.question: Which of the following is FALSE about Hernan Cortez

choices.answer: Used smallpox as a weapon to kill 80% of the Mexica people
Stole 11 ships and later burned them to stop a retreat.
Forcibly converted Montezuma and the Aztec to Christianity
Had a 3 month siege of Tenochtitlan before destroying it.

questions.question: Which of the following is a unique feature of the Aztec legal system

choices.answer: They had a one time forgiveness law
They would shave your head if your were guilty
The death penalty could be used for all levels of society
Judges were appointed by the Huey/Emperor

questions.question: Tenochtitlan was an amazing.  Which of the following is FALSE about this city.

choices.answer: It had the largest marketplace in the world
Had the largest temples and pyramids in the world
Was larger than Paris and Constantinople at the time
It had a 10 mile dam, floating bridges, and over 60 temples
